title: Environmental Emergencies and Illnesses in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What is the primary difference between heat exhaustion and heat stroke?
choices: Heat exhaustion is more severe than heat stroke
Heat stroke is characterized by a lack of sweating, while heat exhaustion involves heavy sweating
Heat exhaustion only occurs in humid climates
Heat stroke is easily treatable without medical intervention
questions.answer: Heat stroke is characterized by a lack of sweating, while heat exhaustion involves heavy sweating

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a symptom of heat exhaustion?
questions.answer: Hot, dry skin

questions.question: What is the first step in treating a victim of heat stroke?
questions.answer: Call emergency services immediately

questions.question: Which factor contributes to the risk of heat-related illnesses in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: High humidity

questions.question: What is the correct order of the drowning process?
choices: Surprise, Unconsciousness, Involuntary breath holding, Hypoxic convulsions, Clinical death
Involuntary breath holding, Surprise, Unconsciousness, Clinical death, Hypoxic convulsions
Surprise, Involuntary breath holding, Unconsciousness, Hypoxic convulsions, Clinical death
Unconsciousness, Surprise, Involuntary breath holding, Hypoxic convulsions, Clinical death
questions.answer: Surprise, Involuntary breath holding, Unconsciousness, Hypoxic convulsions, Clinical death

questions.question: What is the first priority in a water rescue situation?
questions.answer: Ensure rescuer safety

questions.question: Which of the following is a water-related risk specific to Timor-Leste?
choices: Presence of lifeguards at all beaches

questions.question: What is the scientific name of the Timor Island Pit Viper?

questions.question: What is the correct first aid procedure for insect stings?

choices: Apply warm, dry cloths to the body

choices: Check for breathing and begin rescue breathing if necessary

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct step in providing first aid for a snake bite in Timor-Leste?
choices: Apply a tourniquet above the bite
Attempt to capture the snake for identification
Mark the edge of the swelling and note the time
Encourage the victim to walk to seek help

choices: To slow the spread of venom through the lymphatic system
To induce swelling for easier venom extraction

choices: Developing culturally appropriate educational materials in Tetum
Discouraging the use of traditional remedies entirely
questions.answer: Developing culturally appropriate educational materials in Tetum

questions.question: What is the primary language used for creating public health materials in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Tetum

questions.question: What is the recommended first aid for heat stroke in Timor-Leste?
choices: Give the person a warm bath
Encourage them to drink large amounts of water quickly
Move them to a cooler place and lower body temperature with cool cloths
Advise them to continue their activities but at a slower pace
questions.answer: Move them to a cooler place and lower body temperature with cool cloths

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct step in providing first aid for an insect sting in Timor-Leste?
choices: Apply heat to the affected area
Encourage vigorous scratching to remove venom
Use a credit card to scrape out the stinger
Apply a tight bandage around the entire limb
questions.answer: Use a credit card to scrape out the stinger

questions.question: What is the primary goal of integrating traditional and modern first aid approaches in Timor-Leste?
choices: To provide culturally acceptable and effective care
To reduce the need for medical training
questions.answer: To provide culturally acceptable and effective care

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct action when encountering a potential drowning victim in Timor-Leste?
choices: Immediately jump into the water to save them
Throw them a flotation device if available
Wait for professional help to arrive
questions.answer: Throw them a flotation device if available
